content.question: Wires <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> are made of the same material and have the same length but different cross-sectional areas <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, with <math alttext="A sub 1 is greater than A sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The wires are connected in series to a battery, as shown above. If <math alttext="delta V sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are the potential differences across the wires, then which of the following expressions is correct and gives the best rationale why?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta V sub 1 equals delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the two resistors are on the same path.

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 equals delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the two resistors are the same length.

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 equals delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the resistors are connected to the same battery.

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 is less than delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has the greatest cross-sectional area.

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 is greater than delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has the greatest cross-sectional area.

content.answer: <math alttext="delta V sub 1 is less than delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has the greatest cross-sectional area.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
